alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Monroe; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Belmont, Guernsey, Monroe, Muskingum and Noble. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM EDT, flooding is ongoing across multiple areas where 2 to 4 inches of rain fell Thursday evening. Particular areas of concern include locations along the west, middle, and east forks of Duck Creek, as well as Dyes fork, Sharon fork, and Olive Green Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cambridge, Caldwell, New Concord, Byesville, Dudley, Quaker City, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Cumberland, Lore City, Old Washington, Summerfield, Belle Valley, Lewisville, Sarahsville, Dexter City, Salesville, High Hill, Stafford and Graysville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
